Title: Mathematical Statistician
Company: US National Institute of Standards and Technology
Description: * *  Duties *  Incumbent will contribute as a technical expert and leader in collaborative research in measurement science for the Statistical Engineering Division at the National Institute of Standards and Technology. The position requires expertise and experience in data-driven problem solving through the fitting and assessment of statistical models. The types of models typically required include linear and non-linear parametric models, Bayesian hierarchical models, or non-parametric models. This position also requires expertise and experience in the associated computational methods for model fitting or optimization; expertise in data visualization, applied statistical computation using modern statistical software, and the communication of complex statistical concepts to non-statistical scientific audiences. While not required, expertise and experience in statistical experiment design also would be beneficial. Finally, duties of this position also include assistance of Division management with development of operational plans and policies in areas such as hiring and retaining a diverse work force, improved delivery of Division services, and mentoring and development of junior staff members, interns, or other associates * *  *  Requirements *  Conditions of Employment *  U.S. citizenship *   Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service *   Suitable for Federal employment *   Bargaining Unit Position: No *  *   Qualifications *   *    A. Combination of education and experience - at least 24 semester hours of mathematics and statistics, including at least 12 hours in mathematics and 6 hours in statistics, as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education.*    In addition to the above basic requirements: Applicants must have at least one year (52 weeks) of the specialized experience at the GS-14 level (ZP-IV at NIST), experience working with collaborative research teams in the physical sciences or analogous application areas documented through joint publications in the scientific literature.
